content.question: <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math><math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math><math alttext="negative 2"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math><math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math><math alttext="negative 3"><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math><math alttext="0"><mn>0</mn></math> The table gives the coordinates of four points on the graph of an ellipse centered at the origin in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane. The four points are on the vertical and horizontal lines of symmetry of the ellipse. Which of the following is an equation for this ellipse?

choices.label: <math alttext="x squared over 4 minus y squared over 9 equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="x squared over 9 minus y squared over 4 equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="x squared over 4 plus y squared over 9 equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

<math alttext="x squared over 9 plus y squared over 4 equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x squared over 9 plus y squared over 4 equals 1"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>9</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
